answers.author: Lawrence Di Re
answers.text:
Social media is not a magic bullet to strengthen community engagement.  The digital divide is still a reality for many Americans.  Not knowing specifics of the community I would suggest that the staff and local leaders get a good understanding of how "connected" their community actually is.  Also not certain about the motivation for this communication strategy.  Perhaps the community already has asked the question what they hope\intend to accomplish or improve by using social media.  And how they will know if that strategy is succeeding.  I also recommend this article as a good thought piece on social media that goes beyond preconceived notions of what that media can do.    http://www.naspaa.org/jpaemessenger/Article/VOL18-3/04_Eikenberry.pdf

answers.author: Victoria Hutter
answers.text:
Participation in arts programs has proven to be a great way to engage citizens. The National Endowment for the Arts published a study, Art-Goers in Their Communities: Patterns of Civic and Social Engagement that is available here http://www.arts.gov/research/Notes/98.pdf

author: Toni Shope
text:
A locality is looking for ways others are positively increasing the impact of communication between citizens and their local government, especially with social media, to strengthen community engagement.  
Please share the tools you are utilizing. 
Thank you.
title: Tools Used to Strengthen Communication with Citizen
